meanings.definition: A projecting support of stone or brick built against a wall.
meanings.sent1: The ancient castle had a strong buttress to hold up its walls.
meanings.sent2: The architect included a buttress in the design to support the weight of the building.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel thought the buttress was a great place to hide its acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship was a sturdy buttress during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The buttress stood tall like a guardian protecting the wall.

meanings.sent1: The team worked together to buttress their chances of winning the game.
meanings.sent2: She tried to buttress her argument with strong evidence.
meanings.sent3: The chef wanted to buttress the flavor of the soup with extra spices.
meanings.sent4: His encouraging words helped to buttress her confidence before the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The safety net was there to buttress the trapeze artist's daring performance.
